oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James A. Cayce Administration Building, c.1940s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the James A. Cayce Administration Building, c.1940s. The Cayce Homes (Project Tenn. 5-1) were built between 1939 and 1941 as a white-only community, designed by Marr & Holman architects. The Administration Service Building is designed in the Classic Revival architectural style, and it was completed in 1943. The building was home to the Nashville Housing Authority, and it was added to the National Register of Historic Places listings in Davidson County, Tennessee in 2019. Photographed by Wiles-Hood Photographers. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
